question: {name1}'s dog has {n1} puppies, {k1} of which have spots. {name2}'s dog has {n2} puppies, {k2} of which have spots. {name3} has {n3} dogs, each having {k3} puppies with spots. After a visit to the vet, {name1} discovered that half of his unspotted puppies actually have spots that were not visible before. What percentage of all the puppies have spots?
